chapter.title: Environments
chapter.para: In this chapter we discuss different environment types that we envision. During the discussions we position the environments and characterise their properties.

By environment we mean: collaborating ICT infrastructure elements on which services run. In an environment, we have a network (data transport mechanism), some compute nodes (e.g. KVM machines), and data storage (e.g. disks on the KVM hosts). In the environment, we run an LDAP service, a DNS service, a Provisioning service (Spacewalk), etc. In other words, it is an infrastructure domain in which we provide different services.

warning.title: The notion of environment in this chapter must not be confused with the Puppet parameter $environment.
warning.para: In the Puppet configuration one can set the parameter $environment, to define the set of configuration parameters used according to the Puppet Directory environments mechanism. Since the environment notion in this chapter also yields a puppet Parameter, we name it $depzone, for Deployment zone.
